result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Petition for appointment of counsel, affidavit of indigency and order.  Atty. Gerard Werner is appointed as counsel.
Defendant is to repay Sheboygan County at the rate of $50 per month until total sum is paid.
The first payment shall be made on 7/1/22.  $100 per hour, not to exceed a total of $750 without prior approval of Court.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 24, 2022 at 09:15 am.

2:04 PM Prosecuting attorney Joan M. Korb in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jarrod Latonio Love in court. 
Deft advised of rights, rcvd. criminal complaint/reading waived.
Deft waiting for Court appointed Attorney prior to requesting a preliminary hearing. 
Deft does not qualify for Public Defender. 
Court appoints Atty Daniel Mitchell; Deft to pay $50 per month commencing 7/1/22.
Court resets IA for Atty to appear w/Deft.
Initial appearance scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Initial appearance on June 20, 2022 at 11:15 am.
